keyTakeAways: President Donald Trump announced the end of all US payments and subsidies to Colombia, accusing President Gustavo Petro of failing to curb drug production despite years of financial support.
The US has provided approximately $210 million in assistance to Colombia this fiscal year, including $31 million in agricultural support, making it the largest funder of Colombia's security.
Colombia is the world’s leading producer of cocaine, accounting for nearly two-thirds of global production, according to the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime.
Trump criticized Petro for drug production, calling him an 'illegal drug leader' with a 'fresh mouth,' and warned he would take action if Colombia did not address drug production.

Petro responded by invoking Gabriel García Márquez’s novel 'One Hundred Years of Solitude,' criticizing Trump's approach as ignorant and out of touch, and asserting his socialist values and commitment to life and solidarity.
The US conducted a military strike on a vessel believed to be affiliated with a Colombian terrorist group, killing all three onboard, marking the seventh such strike in the Caribbean.
In a prior incident, the US revoked Petro’s visa after he publicly urged American soldiers to disobey Trump during a UN visit, reflecting deepening diplomatic friction.

summaryOfNewsArticle: President Donald Trump announced on October 19, 2025, that he would end all US financial payments and subsidies to Colombia, citing President Gustavo Petro’s failure to combat drug production. The move escalates a long-standing diplomatic and political conflict between the two leaders, rooted in disagreements over drug trafficking, migration, and foreign policy. The US has provided over $210 million in aid this fiscal year, with Colombia being the world’s top cocaine producer. Trump accused Petro of being an 'illegal drug leader' and threatened further military action, while Petro responded by invoking Gabriel García Márquez’s novel 'One Hundred Years of Solitude' to criticize Trump’s ignorance and ideological incompatibility. The article also details recent US military strikes in the Caribbean on vessels linked to drug trafficking, highlighting the growing militarization of the conflict and the deepening rift between the US and Colombia.
title: Trump Escalates Back-and-Forth with Colombia’s President, Announcing End of US Payments to Country
